title: Example: Missing validation caused data corruption
content: Input validation was skipped for performance reasons
Malformed data propagated through the pipeline
Downstream systems produced incorrect results for 3 days
rule: All external inputs MUST be validated before processing
implication: Data corruption propagates silently; recovery requires full reprocessing
verify: grep -rn 'validate' src/ | head -20 || echo 'WARN: no validation found'

title: Example: Cache key collision caused wrong data returned
content: Cache keys were generated using only user ID without query context
Different queries for same user returned cached results from other queries
Users saw other users data for 2 hours
rule: Cache keys MUST include full request context (user ID + query params hash)
implication: Cache collisions cause data leakage between users/requests
verify: grep -rn 'cache_key' src/ | grep -v 'query' | head -20 || echo 'OK: cache keys appear to include query'

title: Example: Timezone bug caused scheduled jobs to run twice
content: Scheduler used local time but workers used UTC
During DST transition jobs ran twice
Resulted in duplicate processing and wasted compute
rule: All timestamps MUST be timezone-aware UTC; use datetime.now(timezone.utc)
implication: Timezone confusion causes duplicate processing or missed jobs
verify: grep -rn 'datetime.now()' src/ | grep -v 'timezone' | head -20 || echo 'OK: datetime.now() appears to use timezone'
